pullRequest.title: [DOCS] EQL: Update EQL search response format
pullRequest.bodyText:
Changes:

Documents the _version, _seq_no, and _primary_term response properties for sequence queries.
Removes unneeded // TEST comments related to the fields response property for sequence queries.
Removes the sort property.
Updates sample data and snippets to be more realistic (auto-gen IDs) and ECS-compliant (changes process.path -> process.executable)

Relates to #59552

commit.message: [DOCS] EQL: Update EQL search response format

afterCommit.message: [DOCS] EQL: Update EQL search response format

nodes.bodyText:
This is nested under the sequences property, which is documented as returned for sequence queries only:
https://elasticsearch_59554.docs-preview.app.elstc.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/master/eql-search-api.html#eql-search-api-response-body
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -433,10 +433,25 @@ Name of the index containing the event.
 
 `_id`::
 (string)
-(string)
 Unique identifier for the event.
 This ID is only unique within the index.
 
+`_version`::
+(integer)
+Version of the document (event). This version is incremented each time the document is
+updated.
+
+`_seq_no`::
+(integer)
+Sequence number assigned to the document (event).
++
+Sequence numbers are used to ensure an older version of a document
+doesn’t overwrite a newer version. See <<optimistic-concurrency-control>>.
+
+`_primary_term`::
+(integer)
+Primary term assigned to the document. See <<optimistic-concurrency-control>>.
+
